alert.note: Alert for Marinette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 9:40PM CDT until April 17 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Green Bay WI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Menominee River near Vulcan affecting Dickinson, Menominee and Marinette Counties. For the Menominee River...including Vulcan...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menominee River near Vulcan. * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, There is widespread flooding of low lying land, farm land and wooded areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday morning, cresting around 16.0 feet this weekend, then falling below flood stage later Monday. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.5 feet on 05/03/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning.
